branch.translation[0].definitions[0].def: a part of a tree that grows out from the trunk (=main stem) and that has leaves, fruit, or smaller branches growing from it
branch.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: After the storm, the ground was littered with twigs and branches.
The topmost branches were full of birds.
branch.translation[0].definitions[1].def: a local business, shop etc that is part of a larger business etc
branch.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: The bank has branches all over the country.
She now works in our Denver branch.
They’re planning to open a branch in St. Louis next year.
Have you met our branch manager, Mr. Carlson?
branch.translation[0].definitions[2].def: a part of a government or other organization that deals with one particular part of its work
branch.translation[0].definitions[2].not: the executive/judicial/legislative branch (=the three main parts of the US government)
branch.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: All branches of government are having to cut costs.
branch.translation[0].definitions[3].def: one part of a large subject of study or knowledge
branch.translation[0].definitions[4].def: a group of members of a family who all have the same ancestors
branch.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: the wealthy South American branch of the family
branch.translation[0].definitions[5].def: a smaller less important part of a river, road, or railway that leads away from the larger more important part of it
branch.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: The rail company may have to close the branch line to Uckfield.
branch.translation[1].definitions[0].def: to divide into two or more smaller, narrower, or less important parts
branch.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: When you reach the village green, the street branches into two.
branch.translation[2].definitions[0].def: an individual bank, shop, office etc that is part of a large organization
branch.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The business has 170 branches throughout the UK.
To talk to one of our specialist financial advisers, just contact your local branch.
branch.translation[2].definitions[1].def: a part of a government or a large organization that deals with one particular type of work
branch.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: The executive and judicial branches of government would be totally separate.
branch.translation[2].definitions[2].def: a small local organization that is part of a TRADE UNION
branch.translation[2].definitions[2].exa: He is a former chairman of the Belfast branch of the National Union of Journalists.
She joined the strike support committee and started going to branch meetings.
